docs.text: Zheming Gao (高哲明) I am an Assistant Professor in the College of Information Science and Engineering at Northeastern University (Shenyang, China). I work on Methodologies of machine learning Optimization theories Numerical optimization and algorithm design with applications to electric load forecasting, healthcare, and other areas of data analytics and optimization. My research work is highly interdisciplinary. I am always looking to collaborate with researchers from engineering, mathematics, computer science, and medicine. Education Ph.D., Operations Research, North Carolina State University, 2020. Co-Advisors: Dr. Shu-Cherng Fang , Dr. Negash G. Medhin . M.S., Operations Research, North Carolina State University, 2019. M.S., Mathematics, Texas A&M University, 2016. B.S., Mathematics, Beihang University, 2015. Awards and Honors Excellent Faculty Award, College of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University (2022) Salah E. Elmaghraby Distinguished Student Award, Graduate Program in Operations Research at NC State University (2019) Third Place in the RAS Problem Solving Competition, INFORMS (with Jin Xu, Haochen Luo and Qian Wu, 2018) Contact Email: email

docs.text: Research My current research focuses on addressing analytical, computational, and scalability challenges associated with the development of machine learning and optimization methodologies for applications in healthcare and electric load forecasting. Methodologies Kernel-free support vector methods Applications Programming Julia tutorial
